item.title: Fire breaks out at AL office in Chandpur
item.description: A fire broke out at a local office of the Bangladesh Awami League in Chandpur on Friday night. The incident occurred around 10:00 pm at the partyâ€™s office located in the Kalibari area of the town. Being informed, members of the Fire Service rushed to the spot brought the fire under control

item.title: Khosru, Moyeen, Reza Kibria among choices for fin min
item.description: A number of names have surfaced as finance minister of the new government set to be formed in a couple of days, led by chairman of Bangladesh Nationalists Party (BNP) Tarique Rahman. item.title: Business leaders look to elected govt with cautious optimism
item.description: Business leaders look to the oncoming political government with cautious optimism that the transition would restore confidence among local and foreign investors and international buyers. They expressed such optimism as the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) prepares to form the government with a c

item.title: Daunting socioeconomic tasks await new govt
item.description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP)-led alliance is going to form a new government with heavy socioeconomic burdens after its landslide victory in the 13th national election. The $462 billion economy has recently been passing through a sluggish state due to the absence of an elected and democra

item.title: 11 from apparel sector bag JS seats in 13th national polls
item.description: At least 11 apparel and textile owners and their family members have won seats in the 13th Jatiya Sangsad (JS) elections, according to unofficial results, highlighting the growing political influence of business leaders from the country's readymade garment and textile sectors. item.title: Jamaat reviews party's performance after polls
item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami (BJI) convened on Friday evening an emergency meeting of its Central Executive Council to review party's electoral performance and post-poll developments. The BJI convened the meeting following growing internal pressure within the party over its electoral performance and

item.title: Gazette issued for newly elected MPs
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) has gazetted all 297 declared winners of the general election, paving the way for their swearing-in as members of parliament. On Friday night, after approving the results, the commission led by AMM Nasir Uddin authorised the notification, with EC Secretary Akhtar Ahmed

item.title: Two killed 'while making bombs' in Chapainawabganj
item.description: Two people were killed and three others injured in an explosion while they were allegedly making bombs in Sadar upazila of Chapainawabganj district early Saturday. The identities of the deceased could not be known immediately, according to a UNB report. The explosion occurred around 5:00 am in Bh

item.title: Why Bangladesh needs an AI-driven primary healthcare revolution
item.description: Bangladesh's healthcare system has achieved notable success over the decades, particularly in immunization, maternal health, and infectious disease control. item.title: The affable relationship between crows and humans
item.description: Of the birds that live close to human habitation, crow is one. Although unlike sparrows which fabricate their nests in strategic corner of a house, the clever crows build their nests not exactly within a residence but at more strategic points such as on a tree or electric poles. item.title: Refiners seek further upward adjustment of edible oil prices
item.description: Local refiners have sought an upward adjustment of edible oil prices amid forecast of decline in prices of the item in the international market, sources said. item.title: Weekly market review: Investor optimism drives stocks higher
item.description: The benchmark index of the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) extended its bullish run for a fourth week in a row, driven by expectations of a favourable market outlook amid anticipated post-election political clarity.
